intro: Lasianthaea ritovegana, commonly known as the Malagasy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
